title: PubChem BioAssay
scope: Millions of assays, small-molecule readouts, activity data.
description: The worldâ€™s largest open bioassay database. Contains millions of high-throughput screening experiments linking small molecules to biological targets.
use: Activity prediction, target discovery, QSAR modeling.

title: ATILA Biosystems
scope: FDA-cleared diagnostic kits for infectious diseases, cancer, and biomarkers.
description: Developer of FDA-approved and research-grade molecular diagnostic kits. Applications include infectious disease detection, oncology biomarkers, and rapid clinical assays.
use: Clinical validation, biomarker AI models, translational research.

title: BioAssay Ontology (BAO)
scope: Structured definitions of assay types, endpoints, and technologies.
description: Ontology defining relationships between assay formats, endpoints, and technologies, enabling semantic AI interpretation of bioassay data.
use: Data harmonization, reasoning graph alignment, assay standardization.

title: ClinicalTrials.gov
scope: Global registry of diagnostic and therapeutic trials with molecular endpoints.
description: Global registry of human clinical studies maintained by the NIH. Provides structured information on diagnostic and interventional trials.
use: Clinical outcome prediction, drug repurposing, safety profiling.

title: Human Protein Atlas
scope: Expression data for 26K human proteins across tissues and diseases.
description: Tissue-level and single-cell protein expression database mapping 26,000 proteins across normal and disease states.

title: Laboratory Diagnostic Tests (LDTs)
scope: In-house diagnostic assays used for precision medicine and patient stratification.
description: Curated data from clinical labs and partners. Includes molecular test performance metrics and patient-level validation studies.
